parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural

str2: From rheo; an utterance, ; by implication, a matter or topic; with a negative naught whatever.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Judea, a Roman province, capital Jerusalem. Feminine of Ioudaios; the Judaean land, a region of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Of Hebrew origin; Galiloea, a region of Palestine.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The rite or ceremony of baptism. From baptizo; baptism.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular

str2: Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.
